meanings.sent1: The cat beleapt the fence effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: The athlete beleapt the hurdle with grace.
meanings.sent3: The kangaroo beleapt over the lazy dog, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her heart beleapt with joy as she crossed the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The gazelle beleapt across the savanna, a picture of speed and agility.

meanings.definition: To have leaped or jumped over.
meanings.sent1: She had beleapt the stream before anyone could stop her.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel had beleapt from tree to tree in search of nuts.
meanings.sent3: The ninja had beleapt over the wall, disappearing into the night.
meanings.sent4: His words had beleapt over all barriers, touching her heart deeply.
meanings.sent5: The memory of their laughter had beleapt into her mind, bringing a smile to her face.
